test.doc: In the previous test case, we verified the BlogPostAPI's specification. In this test case, we query the API for existing postings in the system. If there are pre-existing postings in the system, we check if each posting's fields are matching against the POSTING_SPEC. That is, each pre-set posting has all the fields specified in POSTING_SPEC. If not, the test fails. If success, then we store the pre-set postings into @{PRE_SET_POSTINGS} suite variable for later use

kw.name: Is Match
kw.doc: Note that registered_postings is a list of postings, which are dictionaries. Each posting in registered postings have 'title' & 'content' keys. expected_posting is a dictionary with keys 'title' and 'content' as well. For each posting in registered_postings, we try to find a match its title & its content to that of expected_posting's title & content respectively. If such a match occurs, we return True, otherwise we return false

test.doc: Having set [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}] in the previous test case, we now will create new postings as specified in [{'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content'}]. Test part: For each posting in [{'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content'}] we will make a seperate POST request. Verification part: After executing the POST requests, we will query the API for all the postings into @{registered_postings}. First, We ensure that each posting in @{registered_postings}, have all the required fields in {'url': {'type': 'field', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'Url'}, 'id': {'type': 'integer', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'ID'}, 'user': {'type': 'field', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'User'}, 'title': {'type': 'string', 'required': False, 'read_only': False, 'label': 'Title', 'max_length': 120}, 'content': {'type': 'string', 'required': False, 'read_only': False, 'label': 'Content', 'max_length': 120}, 'timestamp': {'type': 'datetime', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'Timestamp'}}. Once that first verification step is successful, we move into the second step of verification; we check that all the postings in [{'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content'}] have indeed been created in the system; i.e. we compare each posting in [{'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content'}] against @{registered_postings}; there has to be a match of title & content

test.doc:
In the previous test, we stored [{'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content'}] as [{'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content'}]. (i.e. the newly created postings are stored as [{'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content'}, {'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content'}], where each posting posting to modify (i.e. ptm in short) has only 'title' and 'content' fields (i.e. an incomplete posting entry with missing fields url, id, user, timestamp). ptm(s) cannot be updated into system via PUT request. However, for each ptm, there is a matching complete posting entry in [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}]; matching via title & content fields. We use that entry to make a PUT request. Before making the PUT request, we make a deliberate modification to the entry's content field and after that we make a PUT request passing the entry. The entry is stored into @{expected_modified_postings} for verification phase two.
We also know the currently available postings in the system via [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}] (i.e. pre-set-postings + newly created postings).
After having made the PUT request(s) and formed @{expected_modified_postings}, we make a GET request to have all the postings stored (& updated) in the system. The json payload of the GET request is stored into [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}]. Verification part one: we will ensure that each posting in [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}] is according to the posting spec (i.e. each posting has all the fields in {'url': {'type': 'field', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'Url'}, 'id': {'type': 'integer', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'ID'}, 'user': {'type': 'field', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'User'}, 'title': {'type': 'string', 'required': False, 'read_only': False, 'label': 'Title', 'max_length': 120}, 'content': {'type': 'string', 'required': False, 'read_only': False, 'label': 'Content', 'max_length': 120}, 'timestamp': {'type': 'datetime', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'Timestamp'}})
Verfication phase two: for each expected modified posting (aka. emp in short; an entry in @{expected_modified_postings}), there must be a matching entry in [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'Posting 1 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'Posting 2 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'Posting 3 content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}]; matching should be via title & content fields

kw.name: Is Match
kw.doc: Note that registered_postings is a list of postings, which are dictionaries. Each posting in registered postings have 'title' & 'content' keys. expected_posting is a dictionary with keys 'title' and 'content' as well. For each posting in registered_postings, we try to find a match its title & its content to that of expected_posting's title & content respectively. If such a match occurs, we return True, otherwise we return false

test.doc:
In the previous test case, we updated specific posting(s) (i.e. @{expected_modified_postings}) in the system. These postings have been passed as [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}] to this test case.
For each posting to delete (aka. ptd in short) in [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}], We make a DELETE Request for that very ptd. Once all DELETE request(s) are done, a GET request is made into [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}]. Then verification begins.
Verification phase one: all the remaining entries in the system are summed up to [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}]. (i.e. [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}] == [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}])
Verification phase two: all the remaining entries in the system are according to {'url': {'type': 'field', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'Url'}, 'id': {'type': 'integer', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'ID'}, 'user': {'type': 'field', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'User'}, 'title': {'type': 'string', 'required': False, 'read_only': False, 'label': 'Title', 'max_length': 120}, 'content': {'type': 'string', 'required': False, 'read_only': False, 'label': 'Content', 'max_length': 120}, 'timestamp': {'type': 'datetime', 'required': False, 'read_only': True, 'label': 'Timestamp'}}
Verification phase three: none of the postings in [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}] can be found in [{'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/1/', 'id': 1, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My First Posting', 'content': "My First Blog's content", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:06:54.373451+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/2/', 'id': 2, 'user': 1, 'title': 'My Second Posting', 'content': "My Second Blog's content (modified)", 'timestamp': '2019-12-18T17:07:34.938150+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/99/', 'id': 99, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 1', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.741360+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/100/', 'id': 100, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 2', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:19.949005+02:00'}, {'url': 'https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/101/', 'id': 101, 'user': 1, 'title': 'Posting 3', 'content': 'modified content', 'timestamp': '2020-03-15T16:01:20.156067+02:00'}]

kw.name: Delete All Sessions

suite.doc: This test suite uses robotframework-request library to test BlogPostAPI Note that the API supports only: 'GET, POST, HEAD, OPTIONS' methods on URL: https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/ If you want to update/delete a posting, then you need to use its url. For example: https://glacial-earth-31542.herokuapp.com/api/postings/26/
